channel.title: Windows on Sujith Quintelier
channel.description: Recent content in Windows on Sujith Quintelier

item.title: github: Use Copilot coding agent with Windows projects
item.description:
Copilot coding agent can now be used with Windows projects, running tasks asynchronously in a GitHub Actions-powered development environment.

  • Source: GitHub

item.title: aks: Release 2026-02-08
item.description:
AKS release 2026-02-08 adds new Kubernetes patch versions, expands regional availability for API Server VNET Integration, and introduces several security/behavioral changes plus multiple component/image updates.

  • Source: Release notes from AKS

item.title: security: New Clickfix variant ‘CrashFix’ deploying Python Remote Access Trojan
item.description:
Microsoft reports a new ClickFix variant, “CrashFix,” that intentionally crashes browsers to trick users into running commands that install a Python-based remote access trojan (RAT). The campaign abuses built-in utilities (finger.exe) and a portable Python runtime to reduce detection and maintain persistence on targeted systems.

  • Source: Microsoft Security Blog

item.title: dotnet: .NET Framework 3.5 Moves to Standalone Deployment in new versions of Windows
item.description:
.NET Framework 3.5 servicing on newer Windows versions changes to a standalone deployment model rather than being serviced as part of the OS image.

  • Source: .NET

item.title: github: GitHub Actions: Early February 2026 updates
item.description:
GitHub Actions’ early February 2026 update adds custom runner autoscaling, broadens security controls to all users, and provides early access to new Windows and macOS runner images.

  • Source: GitHub

item.title: github: Docker and Docker Compose version upgrades on hosted runners
item.description:
On February 9, 2026, GitHub will upgrade Docker and Docker Compose on all Windows and Ubuntu hosted runner images except ubuntu-slim, allowing workflows to use the latest Docker releases. Users should test workflows and pin or adjust tooling if they depend on previous Docker behavior.

  • Source: GitHub

item.title: github: arm64 standard runners are now available in private repositories
item.description:
GitHub now offers Linux and Windows arm64 standard GitHub-hosted runners for private repositories, available on the free tier so you can run arm64 CI workflows across all repositories.

  • Source: GitHub

item.title: dotnet: Implementing Cross-Platform In-App Billing in .NET MAUI Applications
item.description:
Microsoft’s .NET Blog introduces a new cross-platform billing sample that demonstrates how to implement in-app purchases in .NET MAUI apps for Android, iOS, Mac Catalyst, and Windows.

  • Source: .NET

item.title: dotnet: Cross-Platform Age Verification in .NET MAUI Applications
item.description:
This post announces a new cross-platform .NET MAUI sample that demonstrates how to implement age verification across Android, iOS, and Windows by integrating platform-specific APIs (Google Play Age Signals, Apple Declared Age Range, and Windows Age Consent). It provides guidance and a ready-made sample to help developers add compliant age checks to their apps.

  • Source: .NET

item.title: azure: [In preview] Public Preview: Azure Functions support for Java 25
item.description:
Azure Functions now offers public preview support for Java 25, allowing local development and deployment to Azure Functions on both Windows and Linux with benefits including enhanced security and extended support.

  • Source: Azure Updates

item.title: azure: [In preview] Public Preview: Azure Functions support for Node.js 24
item.description:
Azure Functions now has public preview support for Node.js 24, enabling local development and deployment to Azure Functions on both Windows and Linux. Node.js 24 does not support 32-bit Windows, so new Windows Function Apps targeting Node.js 24 default to 64-bit to ensure compatibility.

  • Source: Azure Updates

item.title: azure: [In development] Private Preview: Foundry Local Android support
item.description:
Foundry Local is entering Private Preview for Android, adding to existing Windows and Mac support to enable advanced on-device AI for smartphones, tablets, and IoT devices; the release also integrates Whisper models for privacy-preserving speech and audio processing.

  • Source: Azure Updates

item.title: azure: [In preview] Public Preview: .NET 10 Preview Now Available on Azure App Service
item.description:
Microsoft announced the Public Preview of .NET 10 on Azure App Service for both Windows and Linux, enabling developers to run modern web workloads such as ASP.NET apps, Blazor, and Minimal APIs on the platform.

  • Source: Azure Updates

item.title: azure: [Launched] Generally Available: Azure App Service - New Premium v4 Offering
item.description:
Azure App Service has launched the Premium v4 tier, featuring faster processors, NVMe local storage, and memory-optimized options on the latest Azure hardware. This tier supports both Windows and Linux with sizes starting at 1 vCPU and 4GB RAM.

  • Source: Azure Updates
